page.title: 10WILDLIFE 1
page.content: Wildlife abounds all over Exmoor and may be seen in most of the valleys particularly the most remote ones. RED DEER Most notable of all the beasts and Britain's largest mammal, and of course, the one which fascinates the visitor is the red deer which has roamed Exmoor from prehistoric times. The deer are hunted by the Devon and Somerset Staghounds and the season extends from August 4th to the end of April. Devon and Somerset have the greatest concentration of the deer in England. Before the war it was estimated that there were 2000 of them and it is believed that they are still in excess of 1000. A stag loses its horns every year, not later than the 1st of May, the new horns growing in the same period as the ferns on the hillside. The new
